Uses of Class
org.coniks.coniks_server.SignedTreeRoot

  • Packages that use SignedTreeRoot 
    Package Description
    org.coniks.coniks_server
    Provides the classes necessary to create a basic CONIKS server, as well as the classes this server uses maintain the publicly auditable key directory and to perform the CONIKS protocols with CONIKS clients.

    • Uses of SignedTreeRoot in org.coniks.coniks_server

      Methods in org.coniks.coniks_server that return SignedTreeRoot 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static SignedTreeRoot TransparencyOps.generateNextSTR(RootNode root, long ep)
      Generates the STR from the root node root for the epoch ep.
      static SignedTreeRoot TransparencyOps.generateSTR(RootNode root, long ep, long prevEp, byte[] prevStrHash)
      Generates the STR from the root node root, the epoch ep, the previous epoch prevEp, and the previous STR's hash prevStrHash.
      static SignedTreeRoot ServerHistory.getCurSTR()
      Gets the current signed tree root in the server's history.
      SignedTreeRoot SignedTreeRoot.getPrev()
      Gets the signed tree root preceding this signed tree root.
      static SignedTreeRoot ServerHistory.getSTR(long ep)
      Retrieves the signed tree root for epoch ep from the linked list representing the history.
      Methods in org.coniks.coniks_server with parameters of type SignedTreeRoot 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static byte[] ServerUtils.getSTRBytes(SignedTreeRoot str)
      Converts a SignedTreeRoot str to a hashable array of bytes
      static void ServerMessaging.sendCommitmentProto(SignedTreeRoot str, java.net.Socket socket)
      Sends the signed tree root protobuf returned for a client's signed tree root request.
      static boolean ServerHistory.updateHistory(SignedTreeRoot newSTR)
      Inserts the signed tree root for the next epoch at the head of the history hash chain.
      Constructors in org.coniks.coniks_server with parameters of type SignedTreeRoot 
      Constructor and Description
      SignedTreeRoot(RootNode r, long ep, long prevEp, byte[] prevHash, byte[] sig, SignedTreeRoot p)
      Constructs a signed tree root containing the RootNode r, the signature sig, the previous epoch prevEp, the hash of the previous STR prevHash, the signature sig, and the previous STR in the chain p for epoch ep.
